headline: Slow Cooker Mac and Cheese
description: This crockpot mac and cheese recipe is so easy to assemble and make in your slow cooker for a creamy, comforting weeknight dinner. Sure to be a hit!

video.description: Great taste and classic goodness prepared in a slow cooker.
video.name: Slow Cooker Mac and Cheese

name: Slow Cooker Mac and Cheese
recipeIngredient: salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 (16 ounce) package shredded Cheddar cheese, divided
1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed Cheddar cheese soup (such as Campbell's¬Æ)

recipeInstructions.text: Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil. Stir in macaroni and return to a boil. Cook pasta uncovered, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 8 minutes. Drain and transfer pasta to a slow cooker.
Add butter to pasta and stir until melted; season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle about 1/2 of the Cheddar cheese over pasta and stir.
Whisk evaporated milk and eggs together in a bowl until smooth; stir into pasta mixture.
Whisk milk and condensed soup together in a bowl until smooth; stir into pasta mixture.
Sprinkle remaining cheese over pasta mixture; garnish with paprika.

review.reviewBody: Added chopped onions and bell peppers, softened..seems a person can do almost anything with this recipe..üëè üëè üëè

I followed the recipe exactly, and the outcome was great! I have it a 5 star rating for that very reason. It was an easy preparation with tasty results. I would recommend following the recipe for the best results. Going about preparation with improvising your own method could create disaster!
One of my potluck go-tos. This time I doubled it and put it in a 7 qt. I don‚Äôt cook the noodles. It was perfect.

Very easy recipe. I can‚Äôt find the cheese soup in my area so I used the small bock of velveeta. Really creamy and tasty comfort food. I also added about a pound more of cheddar jack cheese but that‚Äôs my family‚Äôs preference.

I made this for Thanksgiving and it was a big hit. The only modification I made was about twice as much cheese and with a mix of mozzarella and cheddar, but even without that I think it would be great. It is definitely getting added to the low effort meal pile!

I've made it twice and it was a hit both times! Used Sharp cheddar and of course added a little more than called for. But the cooked crumbled bacon that I added the last hour the second time took it to a whole new level!!
I make this all the time when I have the family over. I've shared this recipe with others and it is a crowd pleaser.

I normally avoid recipies that call for condensed soup, but I was curious about a slow-cooker mac & cheese. This was suprisingly good and super easy. I added chopped chicken breast, frozen brocolli and peas, chopped onion, and fresh pepper & nutmeg.
My daughter is allergic to eggs so I made it without eggs and it worked.

This was very good. If you want it to taste like grandma use to make omit the condensed cheese and replace with 3/4‚Äôs of a pound of Velveeta and sprinkle a handful of crushed Ritz crackers mixed with a tablespoon of melted butter on top.
so easy, creamy and tasty. My family loves it and brought to a party and got raving reviews.

I took the advice of some reviewers and didn‚Äôt precook the macaroni. Big mistake. I will make this again but will definitely cook the pasta a bit first. Used a full can of evaporated milk and half of the suggested milk (used skim milk). Grated medium cheddar but only used half the amount called for. Added onion powder and paprika. I also cooked n high for an hour then lowered to low but if I had precooked the pasta could have used the low setting which would have been a lot better. Grandkids ate it anyway but will turn out a lot better with these adjustments.
I love it. Anyone ever made it in the instant pot?
This was pretty good. I did, however, change the cheese - 1/2 cheddar and 1/2 sharp cheddar.
I would add some smoked sausage and maybe some buttered peas and make this the main portion of the meal. LOVE mac/cheese
this is my favorite recipe for Mac and cheese! a fan favorite requested for all gatherings!
I‚Äôm not a great cook but this was delicious! Super easy, very little mess to clean up. Will definitely make it again for holiday dinner.

I couldn't find condensed cheese soup so substituted with cream of chicken and added an extra 8 oz of cheese. Used Cheddar Jack cheese. Also added a bonus of 4 oz of Asiago for a little extra yum.
The recipe didn't say if the crockpot should be on high or low. I recommend high. Took this to a family gathering and everyone loved it!
You can skip boiling the pasta. Put milks, soup, pasta in crockpot and cook on high 2.5 hours or low 6 hours. Add cheese and stir well until blended.
It was alright! Probably won‚Äôt make it again, but it was okay‚Ä¶
Easy great and family lived it especially easy to make when having to constantly watch an 11 month old baby.

This was good!! I followed some of the other reviewers suggestions. I didn't cook the pasta, I added as is. I did tweak it with alfredo sauce instead of the evaporated milk and then added 1 cup of the milk instead of 2. We like spicey so I added hot sauce and some mustard along with a dried chili pepper.

This is an outstanding staple recipe! It's the closest consistency and flavor to my mother-in-law's legendary homemade mac n cheese. I make it often for large gatherings and get requests for the recipe all the time. It halves easily (freeze or repurpose leftover ingredients). However, we have gone to making the whole recipe and freezing leftovers in meal portions for quick side dish later on. Thank you so very much for this keeper recipe!!

This recipe is fantastic! I didn‚Äôt have enough cheddar so I mixed what I had on hand- manchego, Swiss, mozzarella and Colby. Before anyone fusses about me giving five stars and not making it exact to the recipe, I‚Äôm mainly grading on how creamy this recipe is. A lot of slow cooker recipes dry out but not this one! I will be saving this one to make again and again and again!

This came out great. I only cooked for 2.5 hours on low. The extra 30 minutes burned on the side when cooking for 3 hours. Made a second time for my son who had his wisdom teeth out. It was very soft and easy to eat. He loved it!

I have made this a couple of times for office holiday potlucks, the type where everyone brings enough food for everyone else. I followed the recipe exactly on those occasions. It was just about the only thing at those potlucks that had absolutely no leftovers at all at the end (the sides of the slow cooker had been scraped thoroughly!) and I've always been asked for the recipe by at least one or two people afterwards.

I've also made it at home and tried a few variations such as adding pieces of bacon/ham, varying the cheese mixture with some aged cheddar and parmesan, and putting a crust of breadcrumbs on top (to crisp them I put the slow cooker pot under the broiler for a couple of minutes), all of which were good I admit, but the basic recipe is a winner in my books.
Made for Thanksgiving. It was a hit! I couldn't find any cheddar cheese soup, so I just stirred a little flour in with the whole milk before adding it to the crock pot.
My favorite mac-n-cheese!

I have made this recipe for years now since it was posted. Amazing, never any leftovers at potlucks and Holiday gatherings. Always get some many compliments how good it is. This is one you will want to favorite, bookmark, and print!
This was kid AND adult tested and got rave reviews from all parties. I will add more seasoning next time. There will absolutely be a next time - this one will be used multiple times!
Amazing exactly as is! My go to for pot kicks because it‚Äôs guaranteed to stay warm! The best comfort food!
Excellent and so creamy. I did cut back on butter and only added 1 egg after reading other reviews. Husband and I both enjoyed this mac and cheese.
Great recipe. I left out the eggs and it was thick and creamy. I added some extra pepper and a pinch of garlic powder. Added extra milk as needed. Huge hit.

I have made this delicious, simple recipe several times and it always gets great reviews. I pre-cook the noodles, as suggested. I only cook them seven minutes. They never get mushy. The only change I made is to add some Sirrocco sauce and some dry mustard to tang it up a bit. This is so good and cheesy, with crunchy bits around the edges.
made it tonight very good
Was disappointed. I was expecting this creamy, cheesey dish and instead the texture was griddy and lacked cheese flavor.

So good! My daughter requested lobster mac and cheese for her birthday and I needed a recipe. This was delicious. I made it in the oven and baked it for 40 minutes and it was perfect. The lobster was the "icing on the cake." I bought cooked lobster meat and mixed it in after everything else. She was pleasantly surprised

I made this according to the recipe and after reading the reviews used half the cheese at the beginning and added the remaining cheese half way through cooking. I added additional milk half way through as it looked like it would be a little dray at the end of the cook time. I should have added more milk as it was dry by the end of the cooking time. I may try again and add more milk to see if it comes out a little creamier. Taste was ok but could use a little more spice.
This recipe was easy to follow and tasted soooo good.
It's a bit Thick , but if you want a creamier texture add a 3rd cup of milk. Will also help to make the noodles more tender.
it was very good it was what I was looking for

Between Cathy P's initial recipe and the suggestions made in the reviews, my first ever crock pot mac and cheese was a huge hit! I doubled the recipe for a sports event, left out the canned soup, used a 12 oz can of evaporated milk and four 8oz packages of shredded 'mac and cheese' blend cheese that our supermarket carries (shredded cheddar, swiss, and american together). I added garlic paste for some zing, and added half of the cheese towards the end. It was super, and the little bit left over was even better the next day.
No changes made. Perfect as is.

Cheesy goodness! I would cut back on the butter, because it kinda floats on top after the cheese melts in. Very creamy sauce from the ingredients! This would be great for a potluck! I cooked my noodles for 5 minutes and the mac and cheese was done at about 2 1/2 hours on low. I used smoked paprika on top and it added in more flavor!
This is my favorite way to make Mac n cheese! An office favorite
My whole family loves it.

Do not put eggs in this!! The reviews that say it is always a huge hit at family gatherings are just being told by family/friends it is good. I am sorry but it sucked. The eggs ruin it. They give it a gritty type of texture. Not creamy AT ALL! And i put a huge amount of cheese in it. The evaporated milk may not be a good idea either.

I did not add the paprika and definitely think I should have done so. I made it for a large group though and wasn't sure they'd all like "spicy." Additionally, I had to cook it at a higher temperature to make sure it was done in time for the gathering.

I sprinkled some breadcrumbs on the top and baked it in the oven. Then, I sprinkled powdered cayenne instead of paprika, and a little salt on top. My husband thought it was perfect. I thought it was a bit bland, but the crusty top and cayenne really made it tasty.

I cooked this exactly as directed, but doubled my recipe. It was a hit at Friendsgiving. I would definitely make it again and would recommend this to anyone who needs an easy recipe for a large group.

I've lost count of how many times I've made this now. Ppl request it for potlucks and holiday dinners, its definitely a favorite! I usually double it for my larger crockpot, and use four different types of cheese (four 8oz bags). Cheddar blend, Colby Jack, mozzarella and provolone.

Made this(1.5x portion‚Äîso 24oz of pasta) for a Thanksgiving work potluck and I‚Äôm surprised at how well this turned out considering how easy it was!! Followed the advice from other comments and did not cook the pasta beforehand(added 10oz of water to the Crockpot), rubbed the pot with the butter but did not melt it, and put in a half of the cheese at the start and the rest in the last hour. Used a mix of about 25% pepper jack and 75% medium cheddar, though next time I might use more pepper jack. Because some of my coworkers don‚Äôt eat eggs, I did not include them. Seemed almost a little too liquidy, but ended up being perfect. Make sure to watch this closely as the timing will depend on your slow cooker‚ÄîI was strapped for time so I raised it to high for 45 minutes. This was a huge hit! Making again for my family‚Äôs Thanksgiving celebration.
Great easy recipe that I have made a couple times now and only change is to put the noodles in raw like others had said. Also I change up the cheeses sometimes and always great results.
I loved it when I made it back in July for potluck at work and I'm going to make it again for football at the bar on Sunday

As with any slow cooker recipe, I hate having to precook anything. I decided to just throw the raw noodles in the mix and it came out delicious. I buttered the dish and then added a few pats of butter on top. The only reason I give it 4stars instead of 5 is because the 2 times I've made it, it has this weird sweetness to it... it's still a delicious recipe, just wish I could figure out how to cut out that sweet taste.

I made this recipe twice now and it‚Äôs a party favorite. I love the crusty too which you don‚Äôt expect from a slow cooker. I‚Äôve been asked for the recipe and others have made it with the same result
I didn‚Äôt boil the pasta. It would have been mush if I did. I also mixed some Monterrey Jack, Colby, and cheddar cheese. Delicious!
Loved it. I took it to a dinner and there were no leftovers. I did cut the noodle cook time in half before I placed it in the slow cooker.
Great recipe!!!!!

I love this recipe for two reasons‚Äî it is very easy to put together and since it cooks in the slow cooker it is ideal for big meals when the oven is occupied. Right after it is done, it tastes excellent. In my opinion it is not as good when reheated as leftovers‚Äî it becomes thick and a little bland. Still a very good recipe and will definitely make again for first two reasons mentioned.

I didn't know what kind of cheddar cheese to use. I'll use medium and sharp next time. I also had to add a lot of salt, pepper, paprika, and chili powder to give it flavour. I added an extra can of condensed cheese soup. However, this was a good base recipe to use.
Great recipe. The store didn't have cheddar soup so I substituted cream of chicken and it turned out just fine! Will make again.

I made this for a work pot luck and it was very good. I did not cook the macaroni and used a combination of pepper jack cheese and Mexican blend. Used half of the butter and added seasonings: garlic powder, onion powder, cayenne pepper, less salt and added paprika. This was ready in less than 2 hours and I needed to add additional milk to keep it moist. All in all, it was a hit even though it was just a little mushy.
This has been my ‚Äúgo to‚Äù for ages now! Love to bake the leftovers the next day too!
I wish I knew what I did wrong. I made this exactly as directed thinking it would be a wonderful meal for our grandchildren. It curdled and was not creamy at all. I threw it out. Help!
Everyone loved it. Toddler and husband included.
I love this! I've had tried other variations of this dish before in the crockpot. I loved the paprika touch in the end. I have leftovers to have this week. Delicious! I would make it again!
Sauce separated, noodles mushy (I only boiled them for 4 minutes). I won‚Äôt it again.

This is a easy , delicious, creamy Mac and Cz recipe! My son likes it cooked a bit more to lessen the creaminess.Its easy to tweet too. Use different flavor cheese, less of one ingredients and more of another. I don‚Äôt think you can mess this recipe up. It‚Äôs good served as a main dish or as a side. 
 Today I‚Äôm making it as a side with grilled chicken breast and broccoli . Yumm..
This recipe is SO easy to make and is super creamy. I have made it a few times, and it is requested at family gatherings since! I may add a variation of a breadcrumb topping next time.

I shared this with my daughter and no matter when we make it and where we share it, it is a huge hit. There is never any to bring home. Even at home, we never have leftovers and if we don, they‚Äôre gone by the following day.
Turned out well, took to potluck was a hit, Great crowd recipe.

Turned out well, not as creamy as I envisioned more like a backed Mac and cheese. I left it exactly 3 hours because we were out of the house. In future I might watch it closer and maybe stop it sooner. Flavor was great though and we all enjoyed.
I added more cheese.

Definitely a keeper. I doubled this recipe & made it 3 times in 1 week. 1st ?? concession stand ... followed the recipe exactly (no paprika) ~ the noodles got too soggy over time but it sold out. 2nd time ?? varsity team dinner (girls insisted I make it again) - boiled the noodles for 3.5 minutes, cooked on low for 3 hours, noodles were better but still a little soft. 3rd ?? sleepover, we didn‚Äôt boil the noodles, put them in and cooked on high for 1 hour then low. The noodles got gummy and clumped together, I tried to add milk but it took away from the cheese flavor. Needless to say the girls finished the double batch. Next time I will boil them for 2 to 2.5 minutes cook it on low for 2.5 to 3 hours and make sure to serve it right away.
Added a little extra cheese. My family loved it !!

I made this EXACTLY as written. My kids did not like it at all. They said the texture was way too weird. I agree. The noodles were mushy and the sauce broke and was really grainy. Won't not be making this one again.

I made this last night and will make this my go to recipe for mac & cheese in the crockpot!

I only cooked the macaroni for 4 minutes because I knew it would cook more in my crockpot (which usually over heats) and I added a lot of black pepper, but I followed the recipe without any other changes. 

Before I turned the crockpot on I thought that there was way too much liquid but it turned out great!
Yes I will make it again! It was so good that I believe everyone went back for second helpings.

I always make changes to most recipes to adapt to our tastes. Looking at the ingredients and others suggestions I did alter by adding to , but not taking away from original recipe. Being a big fan of the carmelized onion and bacon mac' n cheese recipe. I added the mustard and spices to the egg mixture and then again to the milk and soup mixture. Instead of straight cheddar, half was shredded muenster (buttery goodness). Carmelized onions and garlic during the butter and noodle step and at the end adding the milk soup mixture and cheese ... added more dry mustard, paprika, salt n pepper and red pepper flakes with about 3 tablespoons of bacon drippings (from bacon baked in oven for toppings during serving) ; stirred until combined. After cooking 1-1/2 hours ... added more muenster and cheddar for last 30-45 minutes or until done.
For my first attempt to ever cook the "sanctified man 'n cheese" in a crock pot ... not too bad of a turn out. It still needed more seasoning (Paprika, salt and black pepper) and perhaps a sharper cheddar and/or Asiago . All in all though not bad for a crock pot version of the oven baked classic. The oven melts the cheeses better and makes it creamier than this turned out (maybe a cup of Velveeta to help with the creaminess it was missing). It was good, needs some more tweeks for our family, but we will make again.

I followed some suggestions from other reviewers. I did not precook the pasta or add salt. I did add the onion powder, dry mustard and chili powder as recommended. My wife did not care for the texture and thought the flavor was just ok. I think it could use additional seasoning. I might make it again to modify the recipe.

This was okay. I gave it 4 stars because like another reviewer, I wouldn't have had a starting point if not for this recipe. 
I found it to be bland made according to the recipe. Once it was made and I tasted it, I ended up adding smoked paprika (not regular paprika) to it which was a nice flavor and took away the blandness.
I will make this again, but I think I might not just aff smoked paprika, but also a blend of cheeses.

I followed the recipe almost exactly. I boiled the pasta about 4 min first and it really only needed about an hour or so on low in the slow cooker. The cheese does want to star sort of start curdling if you keep cooking it too long. I made mine with a 12 oz can of evaporated milk and no regular milk since I accidentally bought the big can. I should mention, I halved the recipe...which still made a whole crock pot full!!! Really easy recipe and yummy!

Came out great and was a huge hit at a party I took this to.
Couple of changes I made:
1. Added 2 tablespoons of all-purpose flour to give it more texture.
2. Added the second batch of cheese halfway through cooking rather than the start of cooking.
3. Cooked for 2 hours instead of 3. This gives the macaroni some great bite. Though your mileage may vary.
Was good, but I think either my slow cooker was either too hot a setting or was overcooked a bit. Going to try a lower temp and/or cook time.
Used 1/2 and 1/2 instead of evaporated milk
Very tasty dish and easy to make.

Very good mac and cheese! Gave 4 stars instead of 5 only because I cooked the noodles for a little less time (4 minutes) added a few more ounces of cheese and a small dot of mustard. The whole family loved this!
I will definitely make it again. I only had fiesta nacho cheddar soup but everyone liked it. I would cook it a little less- I thought it got a tad overdone,
My go to for pot lucks or group meals
My go to for pot lucks or group meals
Delicious, and very creamy. My husband didn‚Äôt even eat the pork so he could have more Mac and cheese! Will definitely make this again for our family gatherings.

This is a keeper! I made this exactly as stated and it was a crowd pleaser. This comes out very much like a traditional baked mac n cheese. What I love about making it in the slow cooker is that it frees up the oven, you dont have to watch it and it is very portable. I'm making this again because it was so easy and tasted amazing!
Doubled the recipe but not the butter or cheese. Plenty cheesy.

I just made this, followed recipe exactly. I am not cooking it 3 hours because this seems too much cooking. Cooking for one hour on high. I will see if this resolves the recipe problems.

There is a big problem with this recipe for a slow cooker. The cheese will separate and the noodles will overcook when left in the pot for 2 1/2 hours.

I used a high setting and limited the cooking time to one hour. The cheese sauce stayed creamy and the noodles did not fall apart.

Also, the recipe will stick to the sides of the pot and it is a mess to clean.
No changes. Delicious!
No changes. Delicious!
Sent this dish with husband to work potluck. Was gone within minutes! Can't wait to make again so that I can try a bite.

I must have done something wrong. Didn't have much flavor and the pasta turned out mushy. I would cook the pasta very little in the boiling water next time - but not sure I would make it again. Oddly enough, the rest of the group liked it - they didn't love it, but they ate it and took some home.
